subject: *** Idea: Configurable Test Case ***

messageBody:
Hello,

I have been looking at creating a configurable test suite and test
cases.

At the moment we hard-code all the data into our test cases. This
makes it very hard to run the cases against different
databases or data sets. The test cases need to be changed by a
developer and recompiled.

Also, one test case normally consists of several tests. However, we
need to disable some of these tests during
development but enable them again at release time. At the moment this
is done by changing the code (which is very bad).

Finally, we need the ability to run the same tests case with
different data. At the moment (you guessed it) it is done
by adding in a new test case and re-compiling.

To get around all these problems and make JUnit more usable, I am
looking to create a config file.

All comments, advice or suggestions are welcome.


The structure could be as follows. It is very similar to the
structure of the JUnit classes. It is simple and easy to use and it
eliminates all those re-compiles:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<test-suite>
<test-case>
<class>MyTests</class>

<enabled>true</enabled>
<parameter name="providerUrl"
value="t3://localhost:7001"/>
<parameter name="contextName" value="MyContext"/>
<parameter name="user" value="USER"/>
<parameter name="password" value="PASSWORD"/>
<test>
<test-method>GetMyDetails</test-method>
<enabled>true</enabled>
<parameter name="name" value="John"/>
</test>
<test>
<test-method>CreatePerson</test-method>
<enabled>true</enabled>
<parameter name="name" value="Mary"/>
</test>
</test-case>
<test-case>
<class>MyNewTests</class>
<enabled>true</enabled>
<parameter name="providerUrl"
value="t3://localhost:7001"/>
<parameter name="contextName" value="MyContext"/>
<parameter name="user" value="USER"/>
<parameter name="password" value="PASSWORD"/>
<test>
<test-method>ChangeMyDetails</test-method>
<enabled>true</enabled>
<parameter name="name" value="Mark"/>
</test>
<test>
<test-method>DeletePerson</test-method>
<enabled>true</enabled>
<parameter name="name" value="Mary"/>
</test>
</test-case>
</test-suite>
